English:
Okay. What's our next move going to be? I think
we need to get more information after all.
Chinese:
我看看，接下來該怎麼行動好呢？
我想還是蒐集更多情報比較重要。
Korean:
그럼― 다음은 어떻게 행동할지, 다만
역시, 추가 정보 수집이 가장 중요하다고 생각한다
German:
Okay. Was ist unser nächster Schritt? Ich glaube,
wir brauchen doch noch mehr Informationen.

English:
We've got the Digital Waves happening all over the
place, the Mystery Incidents, plus your half-cyber
body.
Chinese:
現在東京都內各地發生數起數碼波異常的離奇事件，
加上你的半電腦體狀態……
Korean:
도내 각지에서 일어나는 디지털 웨이브 이상, 다발하는 괴사건
그리고, 반 전뇌체가 된 너라는 존재
German:
Es wimmelt überall von digitalen Wellen,
geheimnisvollen Vorfällen, und dann ist da noch
dein Halb-Cyberkörper.

English:
Plus there's the Kamishiro case that Matayoshi is 
working on.
There's a lot we need to keep our eyes on.
Chinese:
既然已將神代的事交給又吉刑警處理，
我們現在應該從各種角度，從內外觀察這些現象。
Korean:
카미시로의 사건을 마타요시 형사님께 맡긴 지금, 다양한 시점에서
내외로 시선을 돌릴 필요가 있겠지
German:
Dann haben wir noch den Fall Kamishiro, an dem
Matayoshi arbeitet. Da haben wir schon eine
Menge um die Ohren.

English: Oh, my. We have a visitor.
Chinese: 嗯？似乎有客人光臨了。
Korean: 이거, 손님이 오신 모양이군
German: Oha, wir haben Besuch.

English:
Well, well. So this is Matayoshi's secret
weapon.
Chinese: 嗯……這裡就是又吉叔的“祕密武器”嗎？
Korean: 흐음~… 여기가 마타요시 씨의 "비밀병기"냐
German: So, so. Das hier ist also Matayoshis Geheimwaffe.

English:
Whoa, something is fishy!
What's going on here?
Chinese:
唔唔！好可疑～～～!
這實在是太可疑了～～～！
Korean:
우헥, 수상쩍어~~~!
진짜, 수상쩍어~~~!
German:
He, hier ist doch etwas faul!
Was ist hier los?

English:
Welcome to the reliable and experienced Kuremi
Detective Agency.
Chinese: 歡迎來到信賴和實績兼具的暮海偵探事務所。
Korean: 어서 오세요, 신뢰와 실적을 자랑하는 쿠레미 탐정사무소에
German:
Willkommen im Detektivbüro Kuremi, zuverlässig
und professionell!

English:
Do you have a case for us, Assistant Inspector 
Makiko Date of the Cyber Crimes Unit Special 
Office?
Chinese:
請問要委託案件嗎？警視廳刑事部電腦犯罪搜查課第一強行班
特別分室的「伊達真希子」警部補大人。
Korean:
…의뢰이신가요, 경시청 형사부 전뇌범죄 조사과 제1강행반
특별분실소속「다테 마키코」경부보님
German:
Haben Sie einen Fall für uns, Kommissarin
Makiko Date von der Sonderkommission für
Cyberkriminalität?

English:
Hmph, you already know everything about me?
That makes this even fishier!
Chinese:
哼，看來妳對我的來歷瞭若指掌，
看起來更可疑了！
Korean:
흥, 이쪽의 신원은 이미 다 알고 있다는 거냐?
더더욱, 수상한 냄새가 나는구만!
German:
Hmpf, Sie wissen schon alles über mich?
Dann ist hier erst recht etwas faul!

English:
Well, I've taken the liberty of looking into you,
too.
Chinese: 不過我也調查過妳的事就是了。
Korean:
뭐, 이쪽도 당신에 관한 건
조사해 봤지만 말이야
German:
Ich war aber so frei, über Sie auch ein wenig zu
recherchieren.

English:
That makes two of us.
I guess we'll meet again.
Chinese:
還有那邊那位，我也順便調查了。
嗨……又見面了。
Korean:
거기 있는 너도, 겸사겸사 했지
…여어, 또 만났군
German:
Dann haben wir ja was gemeinsam.
Wir werden uns wohl noch wiedersehen.

English: Hmm... Fishy, you say?
Chinese: 嗯……可疑嗎？
Korean: 흐음… 수상한 냄새가 난다, 인가
German: Hm ... Faul, sagen Sie?

English:
That's a rather lackluster way of putting things
for someone as unique and individualistic in their
word and fashion choices, Assistant Inspector.
Chinese:
沒想到從個性十足、不按牌理出牌、服裝品味極佳的警部補大人口中，
會聽見這麼庸俗的說法。
Korean:
개성적이고 의외성이 있는 언행 및 복장 센스를 갖춘
경부보님의 입에서 나온 것 치고는, 약간 평범한 표현이군
German:
Das ist für jemanden wie Sie, der sich so
individuell ausdrückt und kleidet, aber eine
langweilige Formulierung, Kommissarin.

English: What?
German: Was?

English:
So you say "fishy," but what exactly do you mean
by that, I wonder?
Chinese: 再說，“可疑”這個字到底是什麼意思呢？
Korean:
하지만, "수상한 냄새"가 난다는 건
대체 무슨 의미일까?
German:
Sie sagen „faul“, aber was genau meinen Sie
damit wohl?

English:
Is there actually some foul stench you've turned 
up? Or was that just a figure of speech?
Chinese:
是指現場那種不可思議的氛圍嗎？
或只是一種口語上的表現技巧呢？
Korean:
그런 불가사의한 냄새가 존재하는 걸까?
아니면, 말의 뉘앙스가 그렇다는 것에 불과한 걸까?
German:
Haben Sie tatsächlich einen unangenehmen Geruch
bemerkt? Oder war das nur eine Redewendung?

English: You've piqued my curiosity.
Chinese: 真叫人在意……
Korean: ……신경 쓰이는군
German: Jetzt bin ich aber neugierig.

English: Hey now! What's that got do with anything?
Chinese: 喂！？那種事一點都不重要吧！？
Korean: 어이!? 그런 건, 아무래도 좋잖아!?
German: Moment mal! Was hat das denn mit dem Thema zu tun?

English:
Well... Since you know so much already, I'll just
cut to the chase.
Chinese: 算了……既然妳已經知道我的身份，那就好說了。
Korean: 뭐, 됐어… 신원을 이미 알고 있다면 얘기는 빠르지
German:
Nun ... Da Sie schon so viel wissen, rede ich
gleich Klartext.

English:
You're helping Matayoshi with his investigation,
correct? Then that means you're helping me with my
investigation as well.
Chinese:
你們在幫又吉叔搜查案件吧？
那當然也會幫我搜查案件吧？
Korean:
당신들, 마타요시 씨의 조사를 돕고 있지?
그렇다면 당연히, 내 조사도 도와주겠지?
German:
Sie helfen Matayoshi bei seinen Ermittlungen,
stimmt’s? Dann werden Sie mir auch bei meinen
helfen.

English: Right?
Chinese: 對吧……？
Korean: ………그렇지?
German: Stimmt’s?

English: But of course.
Chinese: 那當然。
Korean: 예, 물론이죠
German: Aber selbstverständlich.

English:
As lowly detectives, we cannot abrogate our duty
to assist the police.
Chinese:
身為小小的偵探，協助警察是理所當然的義務，
我們赴湯蹈火，在所不辭。
Korean:
보잘것없는 탐정으로서, 경찰기관에게의 협력은
당연한 의무이며, 도움을 아낄 필요는 없죠
German:
Als einfache Detektive müssen wir unserer Pflicht
folgen, der Polizei zur Hand zu gehen.

English: Isn't that right, [p]?
Chinese: 事情就是這樣，[p]。
Korean: …그런 거다, [p] 군
German: Habe ich recht, [p]?

English:
My duties are yours, and your duties are yours.
Carry them out to the fullest.
Chinese:
我的義務就是你的義務，你的義務還是你的義務，
你要好好完成你的義務。
Korean:
내 의무는 네 의무, 네 의무는 네 의무
확실히, 의무를 다해 주도록
German:
Meine Pflichten sind deine, und deine Pflichten
auch. Erledige beide gründlich.

English:
Oops, I have to be going.
I have an appointment with a client.
Chinese:
啊……我差不多該走了，
我和委託人約好了要在外頭見面。
Korean:
…이런, 난 이만 실례하겠다
의뢰자와 밖에서 만나기로 약속했거든
German:
Huch, ich muss los.
Ich habe einen Termin mit einem Klienten.

English:
...Ha!
You were just thinking dirty thoughts, weren't
you?
Chinese:
啊…………
你剛才在想色情的事吧？
Korean:
……………아
너 지금, 야한 생각 하는 거 아니야?
German:
... Ha!
Du hast gerade schmutzige Gedanken gehabt,
stimmt’s?

English:
Uh, well, yes.
Don't be ridiculous!
Come again? (said with a straight face)
Chinese:
是、是的……！
怎麼可能！
什麼……？（認真的表情）
Korean:
…네, 맞아요
당치도 않습니다!
……네? (진지한 얼굴)
German:
Ähm, nun, ja, schon.
Seien Sie nicht albern!
Ich habe nur die Ohren gespitzt.

English: ...Hmph.
German: Hmpf!

English: Okay, you're under arrest.
Chinese: 那我要逮捕你！
Korean: 그럼, 체포다
German: Du bist jedenfalls verhaftet.
